author: ABC Radio National
title: Monday Finance with Ian Verrender
text:
Monday 10 August 2015 6:52AM   Australian share market had its worst day of trading in more than three years on Friday, led by a sell-off in bank shares. 
ANZ shares were smashed after the bank partially completed a $3 billion capital raising. 
But the red ink spread across the sector, with the CBA, Australia's biggest bank, plunging 3.8 per cent on Friday and more then seven per cent over the week. 
Bank shares have been under pressure since the sector's regulator APRA signalled last month the big banks had to boost reserves held against their mortgage portfolios by July next year. 
ABC Business Editor Ian Verrender joins Fran Kelly on RN Breakfast to preview the week ahead in business and finance.
